meanings.sent1: The museum displayed facsimiles of ancient manuscripts for visitors to see.
meanings.sent2: The office made facsimiles of important documents to keep a record.
meanings.sent3: The detective mistook the facsimiles for the original painting, leading to a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a facsimile of joy, masking the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The facsimiles of the rare book were so detailed that they looked almost real.

meanings.sent1: The artist created facsimiles of famous paintings to practice his skills.
meanings.sent2: The counterfeit products were facsimiles of the original, fooling many customers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's impression of the president was a hilarious facsimile of the real thing.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a facsimile of happiness, concealing his true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The facsimiles of the designer handbags were so well-made that they could easily be mistaken for the real ones.
